title: Mixed Conditionals: Past and Present Effects
objectives: Understand Mixed Conditionals at Beginner level
Apply Mixed Conditionals in real conversations

vocabulary.example: If I had studied, I would be confident now.
I am tired because I didn't sleep well.

vocabulary.definition: a past situation affecting the present
vocabulary.example: If I had trained, I would be strong now.
Her success is due to her hard work.
If I had more time, I would travel.

content.introduction: Welcome to this lesson on Mixed Conditionals.
content.explanation: In this lesson, you will learn about Mixed Conditionals at the Beginner level.
tips: Practice Mixed Conditionals daily for best results.

exercises.question: Choose the correct sentence: a) If I had studied, I am smarter now. b) If I had studied, I would be smarter now.
If they ____ (leave) earlier, they would be here now.
Describe a decision you regret and how it affects you today.

culturalNote: Mixed conditionals are useful in American English for discussing how past choices impact present life.
